Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and very faint traces of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a list of uncertain character.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.127)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87639) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87639)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 152 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
